definition: goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.
pinyin: qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2 , li3 qing1 qing2 yi4 zhong4
simplified: 千里送鹅毛，礼轻情意重
word: 千里送鵝毛，禮輕情意重

definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
